enterprise.overflowWarning: You have too many non-viewer users and have used up all of your paid seats. Change users to become viewers on each workspaces members page.

samlSettingsForm.invalidMetadata: Invalid XML metadata for the Identity Provider

samlSettingsForm.firstNameAttrKeyHelper: The first name of the user or the full name if 'Last name' is not provided.

loginError.title: Something went wrong:
loginError.help: Please contact your administrator for help.
loginError.defaultErrorMessage: it was not possible to complete the SSO login flow.
loginError.errorSsoFeatureNotActive: SSO feature is not active. Please contact your administrator.
loginError.errorProviderDoesNotExist: this authentication provider doesn't exist or is not available.
loginError.errorAuthFlowError: an error occurred during the authentication flow with the selected provider.
loginError.errorDifferentProvider: please use the provider that you originally signed up with.
loginError.errorWorkspaceInvitationEmailMismatch: your email address does not match with the invitation.
loginError.errorSignupDisabled: sign up has been disabled by the administrator.

admin.name: Admin
admin.description: Can fully configure and edit workspaces and applications.

builder.name: Builder
builder.description: Can fully configure and edit applications.

editor.name: Editor
editor.description: Can fully edit data but not configure applications or workspaces.

commenter.name: Commenter
commenter.description: Can only read and comment on data.

noRoleLowPriority.name: No role
noRoleLowPriority.description: Get default workspace role from their teams.

error.title: Could not fetch data
error.description: An error occurred while fetching the member data.

database.title: {name} database
database.everyoneHasAccess: Everyone at {name} workspace can access this database.
database.onlyYouHaveAccess: Only you can access this database.
database.warningMessage: Other users might inherit access via their respective roles on the parent workspace.
database.headerTooltip: Database roles will override workspace roles.

table.title: {name} table
table.everyoneHasAccess: Everyone at {name} workspace can access this table.
table.onlyYouHaveAccess: Only you can access this table.
table.warningMessage: Other users might inherit access via their respective roles on the parent database or workspace.
table.headerTooltip: Table roles will override workspace and database roles.

selectSubjectsListFooter.helpTooltip: Member role assignments override team role assignments.

membersRoleField.noAccessHelpText: This user requires explicit access to resources.

membersPagePlugin.roleHelpText: Can be overriden with roles on databases and tables.

enterpriseSettings.showBaserowHelpMessageDescription: Indicates whether the help request message should be shown on the dashboard.
enterpriseSettings.coBrandingLogoDescription: Replaces the Baserow logo for a custom co-branded alternative (176x29).

authFormElement.selectOrConfigureUserSourceFirst: Choose a user source to begin using this login element.

localBaserowTableDataSync.name: Source table ID
localBaserowTableDataSync.authorizing: You're authorizing your account to select the data from the source table.

jiraIssuesDataSync.urlHelper: The base URL of your Jira instance (e.g., https://your-domain.atlassian.net).
jiraIssuesDataSync.projectKeyHelper: The project key of the Jira project (e.g., PROJ). Can be found by clicking on `Project settings` in Jira. If not provided, all the issues will be returned.
jiraIssuesDataSync.usernameHelper: The username of the Jira account used to authenticate. This is the email that you use to sign in.
jiraIssuesDataSync.apiTokenHelper: The API token of the Jira account used for authentication. Can be created at https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens.

githubIssuesDataSync.ownerHelper: Username or owner of the repository. Typically in the top left corner `owner / repo`
githubIssuesDataSync.repoHelper: The name of the repository. Typically in the top left corner `owner / repo`
githubIssuesDataSync.apiTokenHelper: Can be generated here https://github.com/settings/tokens by clicking on `Generate new token`, select `All repositories`, then under `Repository permissions` set `Issues` to `read-only`.

gitlabIssuesDataSync.urlHelper: The base URL of your GitLab instance. (e.g. https://gitlab.com)
gitlabIssuesDataSync.projectIdHelper: The ID of the project where you want to sync the issues from. Can be found by going to your project page (e.g. https://gitlab.com/baserow/baserow), click on the three dots in the top right corner, and then on 'Copy project ID: 12345678'.
gitlabIssuesDataSync.accessTokenHelper: Can be generated here https://gitlab.com/-/user_settings/personal_access_tokens by clicking on `Add new token`, select `read_api`.

hubspotContactsDataSync.accessTokenHelper: To generate a private app access token in HubSpot, click on Settings in the top bar, navigate to Integrations > Private Apps, and create a new private app. Assign the following scopes: crm.objects.contacts.read, crm.schemas.contacts.read, and crm.objects.custom.read. Finally, click Create app to generate the token.
